body.p: The Board considered how this narrower scope of the recognition exemption would apply when an entity does not recognise a deferred tax asset and liability of the same amount for equal taxable and deductible temporary differences. Specifically, an entity could recognise a deferred tax asset and liability of different amounts if it is unable to recognise the deferred tax asset in full (see paragraphs BC82–BC87), or if different tax rates apply to the measurement of each temporary difference (see paragraph BC88).
